prompts.name: Smart Categorization
prompts.description: Intelligently categorize emails into relevant categories
prompts.template:
Analyze the following email and categorize it into exactly one of these categories: Important, Newsletter, Spam, To-Do, Personal, Work, Finance, Travel.

Important: Urgent emails requiring immediate attention, from key contacts, or containing critical information.
Newsletter: Mass distribution emails, marketing content, updates from services.
Spam: Unsolicited commercial emails, scams, or irrelevant content.
To-Do: Emails containing specific tasks, action items, or requests that need completion.
Personal: Non-work related emails from friends, family, or personal services.
Work: Professional communications related to projects, meetings, or work tasks.
Finance: Banking, invoices, payments, or financial updates.
Travel: Flight itineraries, hotel bookings, travel plans.

Email Content:
From: {sender}
Subject: {subject}
Body: {body}

Respond with only the category name. No explanations.

prompts.name: Action Item Extractor
prompts.description: Extract specific tasks and action items from emails
prompts.template:
Extract all actionable tasks, to-do items, or requests from this email. For each item, identify:
- The specific task to be done
- Any mentioned deadlines or due dates
- The priority level (high, medium, low)
- The person responsible (if mentioned)

Format your response as a JSON array of objects with these fields: task, deadline, priority, assigned_to.

If no clear action items are found, return an empty array.

Email Content:
{email_content}

Respond with valid JSON only.

prompts.name: Professional Reply Drafter
prompts.template:
Draft a professional email reply based on the original email. Follow these guidelines:

1. Be polite and professional
2. Address all points mentioned in the original email
3. Maintain appropriate tone based on the sender's relationship
4. If it's a meeting request, ask for an agenda
5. If it's a task request, provide a realistic timeline
6. Keep it concise but comprehensive
7. Use proper email formatting

Original Email:
From: {sender}
Subject: {subject}
Body: {body}

Draft your response as if you are the recipient. Include a proper subject line (usually 'Re: [original subject]') and salutation.

prompts.name: Concise Summarizer
prompts.template:
Provide a concise summary of this email in 2-3 sentences. Focus on:
- The main purpose or key message
- Any specific requests or action items
- Important deadlines or dates
- Key people or stakeholders mentioned

Keep it brief but informative. Avoid unnecessary details.

Email Content:
{email_content}

Provide only the summary, no additional commentary.

prompts.name: Sentiment Analyzer
prompts.description: Analyze the tone and sentiment of emails
prompts.template:
Analyze the tone and sentiment of this email. Consider:
- Overall sentiment (positive, negative, neutral, mixed)
- Emotional tone (urgent, friendly, formal, angry, appreciative, etc.)
- Level of urgency (low, medium, high, critical)
- Key emotional indicators in the language

Provide your analysis in JSON format with these fields: sentiment, tone, urgency, confidence_score (0-1), key_emotional_phrases.

Email Content:
{email_content}

Respond with valid JSON only.

prompts.name: Meeting Request Processor
prompts.template:
This email appears to be a meeting request. Extract the following information:

- Proposed date and time
- Duration
- Location or platform
- Meeting purpose/agenda
- Attendees mentioned
- Any preparation required

If any information is missing, note what's unclear.

Format your response as JSON with these fields: proposed_time, duration, location, purpose, attendees, preparation_required, missing_information.

Email Content:
{email_content}

Respond with valid JSON only.
